Solomon or Canticles__01.1:
<u>
              Let him kiss me
             </u>with the kiss of his mouth: for thy breasts are better than wine,
Solomon or Canticles__01.2: Smelling sweet of the best ointments. Thy name is as oil poured out: therefore young maidens have loved thee.
Solomon or Canticles__01.3:
<u>
              Draw me
             </u>: we will run after thee to the odour of thy ointments. The king hath brought me into his storerooms: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, remembering thy breasts more than wine: the righteous love thee.
Solomon or Canticles__01.4:
<u>
              I am black but beautiful
             </u>, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Cedar, as the curtains of Solomon.
Solomon or Canticles__01.5: Do not consider me that I am brown, because the sun hath altered my colour: the sons of my mother have fought against me, they have made me the keeper in the vineyards: my vineyard I have not kept.
Solomon or Canticles__01.6: shew me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou liest in the midday, lest I begin to wander after the flocks of thy companions.
Solomon or Canticles__01.7:
<u>
              If thou know not thyself
             </u>, O fairest among women, go forth, and follow after the steps of the flocks, and feed thy kids beside the tents of the shepherds.
Solomon or Canticles__01.8: To my company of horsemen, in Pharao's chariots, have I likened thee, O my love.
Solomon or Canticles__01.9: Thy cheeks are beautiful as the turtledove's, thy neck as jewels.
Solomon or Canticles__01.10: We will make thee chains of gold, inlaid with silver.
Solomon or Canticles__01.11: While the king was at his repose, my spikenard sent forth the odour thereof.
Solomon or Canticles__01.12: A bundle of myrrh is my beloved to me, he shall abide between my breasts.
Solomon or Canticles__01.13: A cluster of cypress my love is to me, in the vineyards of Engaddi.
Solomon or Canticles__01.14: Behold thou art fair, O my love, behold thou art fair, thy eyes are as those of doves.
Solomon or Canticles__01.15: Behold thou art fair, my beloved, and comely. Our bed is flourishing.
Solomon or Canticles__01.16: The beams of our houses are of cedar, our rafters of cypress trees.
